issue.title: Intermittent failure in feature_fee_estimation.py in check_raw_estimates                                        feerate = float(e["feerate"]) KeyError: 'feerate'
issue.body:
( Reminds me of https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/30640 )

https://cirrus-ci.com/task/5862559074484224?logs=ci#L2975:

```
 node1 2025-02-21T16:00:41.934000Z [httpworker.9] [rpc/request.cpp:241] [parse] [rpc] ThreadRPCServer method=syncwithvalidationinterfacequeue user=__cookie__

 node2 2025-02-21T16:00:41.935352Z [httpworker.13] [rpc/request.cpp:241] [parse] [rpc] ThreadRPCServer method=syncwithvalidationinterfacequeue user=__cookie__ 
 node2 2025-02-21T16:00:41.936338Z [http] [httpserver.cpp:306] [http_request_cb] [http] Received a POST request for / from 127.0.0.1:34802

 node1 2025-02-21T16:00:41.940868Z [httpworker.11] [policy/fees.cpp:398] [EstimateMedianVal] [estimatefee] FeeEst: 1 > 95% decay 0.99520: feerate: 435306 from (384675 - 515502) 100.00% 23.6/(23.6 0 mem 0.0 out) Fail: (301403 - 384675) 87.01% 46.9/(46.9 7 mem 0.0 out)

                                                       ~^^^^^^^^^^^
                                   KeyError: 'feerate'

events.body:
It is actually possible to reliably reproduce this:

```
./bld-cmake/test/functional/feature_fee_estimation.py --randomseed=2986529890161488286

The failure occurs in `sanity_check_estimates_range` on the first iteration of the `for` loop.  

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/88debb3e4297ef4ebc8966ffe599359bc7b231d0/test/functional/feature_fee_estimation.py#L210-L223

It occurs in `check_raw_estimates` on confirmation target `1`.
The fee rate results in `estimaterawfee`  long stats has insufficient data to produce an estimate.

- short 
  ```python3 {
    "feerate": Decimal("0.00366047"),
    "decay": Decimal("0.962"),
    "scale": 1,
    "pass": {
      "startrange": 348912,
      "endrange": 424105,
      "withintarget": Decimal("18.82"),
      "totalconfirmed": Decimal("18.82"),
      "inmempool": 0,
      "leftmempool": 0
    },
    "fail": {
      "startrange": 301403,
      "endrange": 348912,
      "withintarget": Decimal("23.99"),
      "totalconfirmed": Decimal("23.99"),
      "inmempool": 7,
      "leftmempool": 0
    }
  }
  ```
  
- medium 
  ```python3 {
    "feerate": Decimal("0.00435306"),
    "decay": Decimal("0.9952"),
    "scale": 2,
    "pass": {
      "startrange": 384675,
      "endrange": 515502,
      "withintarget": Decimal("23.61"),
      "totalconfirmed": Decimal("23.61"),
      "inmempool": 0,
      "leftmempool": 0
    },
    "fail": {
      "startrange": 301403,
      "endrange": 384675,
      "withintarget": Decimal("46.87"),
      "totalconfirmed": Decimal("46.87"),
      "inmempool": 7,
      "leftmempool": 0
    }
  }
  ```

- long  
  ```python3 {
    "decay": Decimal("0.99931"),
    "scale": 24,
    "fail": {
      "startrange": 301403,
      "endrange": Decimal("1E+99"),
      "withintarget": Decimal("169.53"),
      "totalconfirmed": Decimal("169.53"),
      "inmempool": 14,
      "leftmempool": 0
    },
    "errors": ["Insufficient data or no feerate found which meets threshold"]
  }
  ```

I ran the test using the provided random seed, and it fails consistently.  

> ( Reminds me of https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/30640 )

This seems orthogonal since, in `transact_and_mine`, we sync the mempool of the nodes before mining.

I checked that the nodes have the same mempool before mining, and after mining, their chain tips match as well.  

It appears that the random nature of the number of transactions (along with the random selection of their feerates) generated **10 times** to mine in `transact_and_mine` results in a long stats unable to provide an estimate.
